definition: (usually used in the negative) to answer or reply to sb's question
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: You got a l5 out of 15 on your Part 1 idiom quiz!
sentences.chinese: 你在第一部分十五道成语测验题中答对了五道。

sentences.english: If you guessed the Anti-Mason Party, you win the cigar.
sentences.chinese: 如果你回答是反共济党的话，那么恭喜你，你答对了。

sentences.english: Test takers who correctly answer 60% of the test questions or above will be awarded a certificate.
sentences.chinese: 各等级测验答对总题数之60%以上者可获得证书。

sentences.english: OK, great. So, the majority of you got it right.
sentences.chinese: 非常好你们大多数都答对了。

sentences.english: A row of the correct answer to the question of the more points you get you have.
sentences.chinese: 请你再试答一下，仔细想想，我认为你会答对的。

sentences.english: We get the key when we answer certain questions correctly.
sentences.chinese: 当答对某个问题时获得某把钥匙。

sentences.english: Test takers who answer 60% or more of the test questions correctly will be awarded a certificate.
sentences.chinese: 各等级测验答对总题数之60%以上者可获得证书。

sentences.english: For its first seven weeks, FreeRice gave 10 grains of rice for each correct answer.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始的七周，每答对一个问题是10粒大米。

sentences.english: If you guessed posture then you are correct.
sentences.chinese: 如果你猜的是“站姿”，那你就答对了。

sentences.english: The majority of the study volunteers got the person's job correctly, but struggled with the name.
sentences.chinese: 大多数志愿者答对了工作，但却总记不起名字。

sentences.english: And most of you got that, about 75% of you got that right.
sentences.chinese: 你们大多数都得出这个答案，大概75%都答对了。

sentences.english: I miss all the ten questions but two.
sentences.chinese: 十道题我只答对了两道，其他的全错了。

sentences.english: The monkeys were rewarded with Kool-Aid for choosing the right answers.
sentences.chinese: 答对题目后，猴子会有酷爱饮料做奖励。

sentences.english: I really enjoy them and even answered most of the questions correctly.
sentences.chinese: 我非常喜欢这些节目，甚至大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: Two points for every one right.
If you answer this question correctly, it's worth five points.
sentences.chinese: 答对了这道题可以得五分。

definition: to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)
to draw up the theme (for discussion)
to guess correctly/to figure out the right answer
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
to compete to answer questions (in class)
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
to fill a job vacancy/to fill in a blank (e.g. on questionnaire or exam paper)
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
